Check whether or not the cluster nodes are alive

Source: R/isNodeAlive.R
isNodeAlive.Rd

Check whether or not the cluster nodes are alive

isNodeAlive(x, ...)

Arguments

x

A cluster or a cluster node ("worker").
...

Not used.

Value

A logical vector of length length(x) with values FALSE, TRUE, and NA. If it can be established that the process for a cluster node is running, then TRUE is returned. If it does not run, then FALSE is returned. If neither can be inferred, for instance because the worker runs on a remote machine, then NA is returned.

Details

This function works by checking whether the cluster node process is running or not. This is done by querying the system for its process ID (PID), which is registered by makeClusterPSOCK() when the node starts. If the PID is not known, the NA is returned. On Unix and macOS, the PID is queried using tools::pskill() with fallback to system("ps"). On MS Windows, system2("tasklist") is used, which may take a long time if there are a lot of processes running. For details, see the internal pid_exists() function.

Examples

# \donttest{
cl <- makeClusterPSOCK(2)
#> [14:33:47.842] [local output] Workers: [n = 2] ‘localhost’, ‘localhost’
#> [14:33:47.843] [local output] Base port: 11949
#> [14:33:47.843] [local output] Getting setup options for 2 cluster nodes ...
#> [14:33:47.843] [local output]  - Node 1 of 2 ...
#> [14:33:47.846] Testing if worker's PID can be inferred: ‘'/home/hb/software/R-devel/R-4-1-branch/lib/R/bin/Rscript' -e 'try(suppressWarnings(cat(Sys.getpid(),file="/tmp/hb/RtmpMOktNT/worker.rank=1.parallelly.parent=6856.1ac85e8f45a2.pid")), silent = TRUE)' -e "file.exists('/tmp/hb/RtmpMOktNT/worker.rank=1.parallelly.parent=6856.1ac85e8f45a2.pid')"’
#> [14:33:48.339] - Possible to infer worker's PID: TRUE
#> [14:33:48.340] [local output] Rscript port: 11949
#> [14:33:48.341] [local output]  - Node 2 of 2 ...

#> [14:33:48.347]  $ localMachine  : logi TRUE

#> [14:33:48.371] [local output] Starting PSOCK main server
#> [14:33:48.378] [local output] Workers launched
#> [14:33:48.379] [local output] Waiting for workers to connect back
#> [14:33:48.379] [local output] 0 workers out of 2 ready
#> [14:33:48.873] [local output] 0 workers out of 2 ready
#> [14:33:48.874] [local output] 1 workers out of 2 ready
#> [14:33:48.876] [local output] 1 workers out of 2 ready
#> [14:33:48.877] [local output] - collecting session information

## Check if cluster nodes #2 is alive
print(isNodeAlive(cl[[2]]))
#> [14:33:48.884] Attempting to find a working pid_exists_*() function ...
#> Call: tools::pskill(6856, signal = 0L)
#> [1] TRUE
#> Call: tools::pskill(6856, signal = 0L)
#> [1] TRUE
#> [14:33:48.885] - success
#> [14:33:48.885] Attempting to find a working pid_exists_*() function ... done
#> [1] TRUE

## Check all nodes
print(isNodeAlive(cl))
#> [14:33:48.887] Attempting to find a working pid_exists_*() function ...

#> [1] TRUE
#> Call: tools::pskill(6856, signal = 0L)
